aliceinwaterdeep terminology abbreviations this pattern is written in us terms chain - chain double_crochet - double_crochet slip_stitch - slip_stitch yarn hook 45g approx of dk weight yarn you can use 4 5mm hook as many colors as you like if using three like in this pattern you will need approx 15g of each color final size width x height for this pattern i m using bella coco s confec- cm 10 x 21 5 tion dk you can use whatever yarn you like but i do recommend using a soft yarn to avoid any in 4 x 8 51 accidental scratches on the console additional information you can easily adapt the pattern to use any other yarn weight just measure your starting chain to make sure it matches the final size indicated above and covers the console the pattern is worked in rounds of row so no sewing will be needed on the last page you will find links to tutorials for all the techniques used in this pattern what about the regular non-lite switch console this pattern has been designed for the switch lite but can work and be adapted for the regular switch as well the same measurements can work especially if you re using a soft stretchy yarn but it is a bit more stretched you can see a picture of me using this same case for the regular switch at the end of this file if you want a more relaxed fit or your yarn isn t very stretchy just add 2 extra chains at the beginning so chain 23 instead of 21 this way you will always have 2 extra stitches each row and keep adding row until the whole vertical length of the console is covered © 2023 aliceinwaterdeep the pattern or parts of it double_crochet yarn over and insert your hook in the 5th chain from the hook the remaining ch4 starting with color a chain 21 counts as 1 double_crochet if you want you can add a stitch marker to the top chain of the initial ch4 so you don t complete the first double_crochet forget it later on © 2023 aliceinwaterdeep the pattern or parts of it may not be reproduced altered distributed or sold 3
